summary: This document appears to be a log or notes from the forensic examination of a Samsung Galaxy S9 phone, likely seized in relation to the Epstein investigation. It includes a text message conversation from August 2019 discussing Jeffrey Epstein's suicide watch status and instructions to 'stick to the script'. The log details attempts to extract photos and device information, noting limitations without un-enrolling the device from its network.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of a text message conversation on August 11, 2019, regarding confirmation of whether he was on suicide watch.

events.title: Text message about Epstein's suicide watch
events.description: A text message conversation occurs where someone is trying to confirm if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch, with instructions to 'stick to the script' and say 'Can't comment on that.'

events.title: Email follow-up
events.description: An email is sent at 7:56 AM, following up on the previous text conversation.

keyFacts: A text message from Sunday, August 11, 2019, discusses confirming if Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch.
The message includes instructions to 'stick to the script' and respond with 'Can't comment on that.'
The data is from the forensic extraction of a Samsung Galaxy S9 phone (model SM-G960U, serial R58M21CCSL8).
The extraction log indicates challenges in obtaining forensic support without first un-enrolling the device from its network.
The document references multiple sets of photos on the phone, memorialized and reviewed manually.
